DataElement.preferredName: Prior Treatment Bevacizumab Or VEGFR Inhibitor Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient has had prior treatment with Beavacizumab or VEGFR inhibitors.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Therapy Bevacizumab Or VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy._A drug used to treat several types of cancer, including certain types of colorectal, lung, breast, and kidney cancers and glioblastoma. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer. Avastin binds to vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and may prevent the growth of new blood vessels that tumors need to grow. It is a type of antiangiogenesis agent and a type of monoclonal antibody._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A substance that blocks an enzyme needed to form blood vessels._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy.

Concepts.definition: Prior action or administration of therapeutic agents that produced an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Bevacizumab Or VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: A drug used to treat several types of cancer, including certain types of colorectal, lung, breast, and kidney cancers and glioblastoma. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer. Avastin binds to vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and may prevent the growth of new blood vessels that tumors need to grow. It is a type of antiangiogenesis agent and a type of monoclonal antibody.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A substance that blocks an enzyme needed to form blood vessels.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Any substance that inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptor, a family of tyrosine kinase receptors involved in the formation of blood vessels.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
